summary: The NO FAKES Act of 2025 (HR 2794) aims to protect individuals' intellectual property rights concerning their voice and visual likeness, especially in the context of "digital replicas." It grants individuals and right holders (including after death, with specific timeframes and registration requirements) the right to control the use of their likeness in digital replicas and related products/services. The bill defines key terms, outlines liability for unauthorized use, establishes safe harbor provisions for online services, and specifies penalties. Preemption and construction rules are included.
